headline: 1 Large-Cap Stock with Competitive Advantages and 2 Facing Headwinds
summary: Large-cap stocks are known for their staying power and ability to weather market storms better than smaller competitors. However, their sheer size makes it more challenging to maintain high growth rates as they’ve already captured significant portions of their markets.

content.title: 1 Large-Cap Stock with Competitive Advantages and 2 Facing Headwinds
content.summary: Large-cap stocks are known for their staying power and ability to weather market storms better than smaller competitors. However, their sheer size makes it more challenging to maintain high growth rates as they’ve already captured significant portions of their markets.

headline: Honeywell to end 2025 in the red, but 2026 could be different
summary: Honeywell (HON) was one of the Dow Jones Industrial Average's (^DJI) worst-performing components in 2025, falling over 5% year to date. UBS industrial sector head and multi-industry analyst Amit Mehrotra joins Market Catalysts host Julie Hyman to discuss the stock's 2025 performance and its outlook for 2026. Check out Yahoo Finance's coverage of other Dow(n) Bad stocks: Nike (NKE), Procter & Gamble (PG), UnitedHealth (UNH), and Salesforce (CRM). To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: Does Honeywell Offer Value After Portfolio Shift Toward Automation Aviation and Energy Transition?
summary: If you are wondering whether Honeywell International at around $198 a share is genuinely a smart buy or just fairly priced already, you are not alone. That is exactly what this breakdown is going to unpack. Over the last week the stock is up 2.3%, adding to a 3.9% gain over the past month. That is against a weaker backdrop with returns of 4.9% over three years and 11.1% over five years, while still down 12.2% year to date and 5.9% over the last year.
